TopicTitle: The DLCs and if they are worth it.

Articles.Content:
1. Making History DLC. The making history DLC is in my opinion 10000000% worth it. It and new engines both vacuum and atmospheric.  It also adds bigger fuel tanks along with a tank between the smallest and middle tank. Also it adds in a 2 seater command pod. Do I think you should get it. YES

2. Breaking Ground DLC. The Breaking Ground DLC adds robotics and science  deployed by kerbals! In my opinion its like 50% worth it. Do I think you should get the Breaking ground DLC. Well yes but this one is one you can definitely go without.

I'd say Breaking Ground is better than Making History. The stuff in Making History is just more parts. Breaking Ground has new a new class of science instruments and the robotics are like nothing else in the (base) game.

But if you ask me both are worth it.

9 hours ago, Superfluous J said:

But if you ask me both are worth it.

I agree. Breaking Ground was probably more worth it for me because I like to build cranes and trucks and stuff like that, but both DLCs are definitely worth your money.

12 hours ago, 10_Points said:

1. Making History DLC. The making history DLC is in my opinion 10000000% worth it. It and new engines both vacuum and atmospheric.  It also adds bigger fuel tanks along with a tank between the smallest and middle tank. Also it adds in a 2 seater command pod. Do I think you should get it. YES

2. Breaking Ground DLC. The Breaking Ground DLC adds robotics and science  deployed by kerbals! In my opinion its like 50% worth it. Do I think you should get the Breaking ground DLC. Well yes but this one is one you can definitely go without. 

The best DLC is Restock Plus; It's worth the price tag of £0.00 and these freelancers didn't leave big gaping gaps in the parts selection as KSP's paid professional devs did, while also making the art style a million times more consistent than Squad's attempt at redoing 50% of the parts 

Edited April 15, 2022 by Bej Kerman
